messages.subject: About Science Fiction
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/11/99 1:42:10 PM Pacific Daylight Time, hilinda@lightlink.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/11/99 1:42:10 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
hilinda@... writes:

<< (And about science fiction- how many real things were invented because of
science fiction? Lots. Someone thought of them, then people went on to
figure out how to make it happen, or why it couldn't.)
>>

I have to say that it really does take a bright mind to understand science
fiction.
If your child is into s.f., I say don't worry. It also seems to me that
people who understand s.f. also seem to have alot of common sense and a
clearer understanding about how things work. That's my observation anyway.
I have never understood s.f. My mind just can't comprehend it for some
reason. My dh thinks I'm nuts. I can watch a Star Trek movie with him from
beginning to end and then look at him and say, "What just happened?" I really
have no clue. LOL!
Mary Ellen(the mind that doesn't GET s.f./fantasy)
